title: Morrisons is selling a ghost chilli pizza that's 200 times hotter than a jalapeño
text:

Daredevil pizza fans... Morrisons has the dinner for you.

As the supermarket giant has just unveiled a new 'Roulette-style' pizza, where some random slices contain a very spicy surprise.

Anyone brave enough to try their luck on the 10" trick or treat pizza may be met with the fiery heat of ghost chilli, the seventh hottest chilli in the world that measures over one million units on the Scoville heat scale - that's 200 times spicier than Tabasco sauce.

And as well as an array of ghost-chilli topped slices, there's also one extra fiery 'Devils' slice - filled with Scotch bonnet chillies that measure between 100,000 to 350,000 on the scale.

In fact, the chilli heat is apparently so ‘hellish’ that the pizza comes with a warning label.

All other slices hidden amongst the ‘roulette wheel’ are covered with slightly cooler tangy ingredients, including jalapeño pepperoni and spicy chicken and cheese, with some slices hot and some not.

Setting you back £3, or two for £5, the 10” pizza is available from all Morrisons pizza counters across the country from today, but only until the 11th November.

Shezad Mahmood, Pizza Buyer at Morrisons said: “The aim is to give customers the ultimate trick or treat. The question is will our customers be prepared to roll the dice and face heaven or hell in a slice?”
description: Some slices in Morrisons' new trick or treat pizza contain a very spicy surprise...
